name: Samuel B. McCARTER, Leo Levine and Olive M. Heck, Appellants, v. Merle B. MITCHAM and Butcher & Singer, Inc., Appellees, v. Thomas GABRESKI and Walter C. Shattenburg, Appellees

judges: Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and STOUT, JJ.
parties: Samuel B. McCARTER, Leo Levine and Olive M. Heck, Appellants, v. Merle B. MITCHAM and Butcher & Singer, Inc., Appellees, v. Thomas GABRESKI and Walter C. Shattenburg, Appellees.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM:
Appeal dismissed as having been improvidently granted.
LARSEN and McDERMOTT, JJ., dissent.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM:

attorneys: Irving Murphy, T. Warren Jones, MacDonald, Illig, Jones & Britton, Erie, for appellants.
Edward C. Mengel, Jr., Mark S. Gurevitz, White and Williams, Philadelphia, for Merle B. Mitcham and Butcher & Singer, Inc.
Richard W. Kooman, II, Clarion, for Gabreski and Shattenberg.
casebody.head_matter:
538 A.2d 1335
Samuel B. McCARTER, Leo Levine and Olive M. Heck, Appellants, v. Merle B. MITCHAM and Butcher & Singer, Inc., Appellees, v. Thomas GABRESKI and Walter C. Shattenburg, Appellees.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued March 7, 1988.
Decided March 21, 1988.
Irving Murphy, T. Warren Jones, MacDonald, Illig, Jones & Britton, Erie, for appellants.
Edward C. Mengel, Jr., Mark S. Gurevitz, White and Williams, Philadelphia, for Merle B. Mitcham and Butcher & Singer, Inc.
Richard W. Kooman, II, Clarion, for Gabreski and Shattenberg.
Before NIX, C.J., and LARSEN, FLAHERTY, McDERMOTT, ZAPPALA, PAPADAKOS and STOUT, JJ.
